text:
With foodie influences from Malay and
Chinese cuisine, mixed with the jungle

flavors of Borneo tribes, Sarawakian
food is something to experience. So come

along and I'll show you the top 10 foods
taking in Kuching Sarawak. You thought Durian was bad...

This is Bubur Ayam and it's a popular
rice porridge dish in Malaysia. It's got
some ginger in it and onions and I actually has little bit of chicken in

it.  I thought maybe I might be able to
pick out chicken bits but it's actually

really finely grated in there. It's a
little challenging to navigate otherwise
the flavor is really nice.

It's breakfast time and i was told i
should go to Chinatown to try some of
the Laksa or Kolo Mee.

I have no idea what either look like so
glad they have picture signs.

Kolo Mee is a super popular Sarawakian
in comfort food.

It's boiled noodles with a little bit of
spring, tossed in light oil soy sauce
garlic and msg.

It's said to be the signature dish of
coaching and locals just go crazy for it!

separately or together.

It's got bean sprouts, a little dressing of

It's spicy. I wanna say it's almost like Indian curry.

Right off the main bazaar and Kuching waterfront is Ah Yong ABC, a
popular street hawker known for his
ABC kantong.

ABC is a Malay abbreviation for mixed ice and
it's a popular and refreshing desert in
Sarawak.

Here you can see like jellies of
different types.

Anything from the little small round
ones and the green ones.

Right now it doesn't look very appetizing, but it
tastes really good especially on a hot
day like this.

ABC can talk is a local favorite
striking fond childhood memories in

locals who remember pre-ice cream days. It's
shaved ice flavored with syrup

and it's inexpensive and a great dessert for
the Borneo heat. Just make sure you eat
it fast, before it melts!
